CatDescriptText: Mr. Ledger Mayes, 815 Oakwood Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 1, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think that high school students should strike in order to air grievances or to gain their objectives?"  Answer reads: "Yes, I do. I think that if you are going to fight for something and want it badly enough, it's good to go out and strike.  It is all right for the seniors, but not for those students under them."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ledger Mayes wearing light colored fedora, eyeglasses, and zippered coat, standing in front of store window with smoking pipe display and sign that reads "$2.98"
